{"step_by_step_thinking": "The binder in investment for dental castings is responsible for holding the ingredients together and providing rigidity. It is important for the binder to provide adequate strength to the investment. Silica is commonly used as a binder in dental castings. Gypsum, on the other hand, is not typically used as a binder in dental castings and cannot be safely heated above 700°C. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Provides adequate strength to the investment, holds ingredients together and provides rigidity.", "answer_choice": "B"}
